subject: Sales
title: Marc Benioff and the Cloud Revolution
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Marc Benioff and the Cloud Revolution.

hook.text: Benioff staged a fake protest with 'No Software' signs outside a competitor's event. Pure theater.

buildup.text: He launched Salesforce in 1999 with a radical pitch: no boxes, no installs, just cloud access.

discovery.text: Everyone laughed. Software was sold on shelves in shrink wrap. The cloud was barely a concept.

twist.text: Enterprises realized they could skip IT nightmares and just subscribe. The laughing stopped fast.

climax.text: Salesforce is now worth over $200 billion. Benioff sold the future before anyone else saw it.

punchline.text: He sold software by declaring war on software.

quiz.question: What was Benioff's radical sales pitch for Salesforce?
options: No installed software, just cloud access
